info.title: Arena REST API
info.description:
The Arena REST API provides methods for accessing a resource, such as an Item or a category of Item, at a canonical URL. You can then perform an action upon that resource by specifying an endpoint URL, such as https://api.arenasolutions.com//items//revisions which returns all revisions for a given Item resource. Note that the version takes the format e.g. v1 (no decimal places). The API version does not necessarily change with Arena releases.

The header of all requests must include:
- an access token "arena_session_id" for user authentication (except Log In, which grants a token)
- a content type declaration ("application/json", except for file POST endpoints with content, where the file metadata is JSON and the file payload itself is "multipart/form-data")
- an HTTP method declaration (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)

Requests must be sent uncompressed. Responses may be returned uncompressed or compressed using gzip encoding.

get.summary: Get details of a specific training plan
get.description: Returns a Training Plan object with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update an existing training plan
put.description: In order to edit a Training Plan, the user must be a Training Plan Manager within the workspace. If the user is a Training Plan Manager within the workspace but not the Training Plan Manager of this specific Training Plan, they can only use this endpoint to modify the Training Manager.

delete.summary: Delete a specific training plan
delete.description: Deletes a Training Plan with a given GUID. In order to delete a Training Plan, the user must be the assigned Training Manager of the Training Plan. For Access Policies workspaces, users need a Delete Training rule in order in order to delete a Training Plan.

get.summary: Get details of a specific user in a training plan
get.description: If the GET Training Plan Users endpoint is appended with a valid guid, it returns the information of a specific user in a Training Plan.

put.summary: Update the due date for a user in a training plan
put.description: In order to modify a user in a Training Plan, the user must be a Training Plan Manager within the workspace. Currently, the only modification to a user in a Training Plan supported is the ability to change due date of a user's training assignments.

delete.summary: Remove a user from a training plan
delete.description: Removes a user from a Training Plan. In order to remove a user from a Training Plan, the user must be the assigned Training Manager of the Training Plan.

204.description: Remove a user from training plan

get.summary: Get details of a specific ticket
get.description: Returns a Ticket object with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update an existing ticket
put.description: Updates information for a Tickets with a given GUID.

delete.summary: Delete a specific ticket

get.summary: Get details of a specific supplier
get.description: Returns a Supplier object with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update information for a specific supplier
put.description: Updates the metadata of a supplier with a given GUID. To update values for additional attributes, first retrieve the GUID of each attribute using the GET Supplier Item endpoint. Updated values must be valid for the attribute.

delete.summary: Delete a specific supplier

get.summary: Get details of a specific supplier phone number
get.description: Returns a specific phone number with a given GUID of a Supplier object with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update a specific supplier phone number
put.description: Updates the existing phone numbers of a supplier with a given GUID.

delete.summary: Delete a specific supplier phone number
delete.description: Deletes a specific Supplier phone number with a given GUID.

get.summary: Get details of a specific supplier address
get.description: Returns a specific address with a given GUID of a Supplier object with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update a specific supplier address
put.description: Updates an existing specific phone numbers of a supplier with a given GUID.

delete.summary: Delete a specific supplier address
delete.description: Deletes a specific Supplier address with a given GUID.

get.summary: Get details of a specific supplier item
get.description:
Creates a new Supplier Item object.

NOTES:
1. The values you specify for attributes must match the attribute types specified in the workspace. For example, when specifying a value for a predefined list, the value must be one of the allowed values.
2. Number values must appear in quotation marks.

put.summary: Update a specific supplier item
put.description: Updates the metadata of a Supplier Item with a given GUID. To update values for additional attributes, first retrieve the GUID of each attribute using the GET Supplier Item endpoint. Updated values must be valid for the attribute.

delete.summary: Delete a specific supplier item
delete.description: Deletes a supplier item with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update metadata for a supplier item file
put.description: Updates information about (but not the content of) an existing File with a given GUID associated with a supplier item with a given GUID.

get.summary: Get details of a specific compliance requirement
get.description: Returns a Compliance Requirement with a given GUID for a supplier item with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update a specific compliance requirement
put.description: Updates a Compliance Requirement object with a given GUID for a supplier item with a given GUID.

delete.summary: Remove a compliance requirement from a supplier item
delete.description: Deletes a Compliance Requirement object with a given GUID for a Supplier Item with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update license settings for a partner user

delete.summary: Remove a machine user from the workspace

put.summary: Update license settings for a workspace employee

delete.summary: Remove an employee from the workspace

get.summary: Get details of a specific machine user

put.summary: Update the details of a machine user
put.description:
Updates the metadata of a Machine User with a given GUID.

This endpoint does not support setting the password or token for Machine Users. POST sets the password automatically to a secure random string and does not set the token. Passwords can be set by the user manually in the UI.
This endpoint does not support the ForIntegrationUse attribute.

get.summary: Get detailed information about a specific employee
get.description: Users are managed in Arena at the account level. Users can then belong to 0 or more workspaces that are associated with the account.

put.summary: Update the details of a specific employee
put.description:
Updates the metadata of an Employee User with a given GUID.

Neither twoFactorAuthenticationConfigured nor securityQuestionConfigured can be set using the API.
If notifyUser is specified and the user has not reset their password, the following error is returned: notifyUser is not editable until the user resets their password.
This endpoint does not support the ForIntegrationUse attribute.
There is no response for temporaryPassword and notifyUser.

get.summary: Get details of a specific request
get.description: Returns a Request object with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update an existing request
put.description: Updates attribute information for a Request with a given GUID.

delete.summary: Delete a specific request
delete.description: Deletes a Request with a given GUID. Requests can only be deleted in the Open and Unsubmitted, Deferred, and Closed lifecycle statuses.

get.summary: Get details of a specific item in a request
get.description: Returns a Request Item with a given GUID included in a request with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update notes for a specific item in a request
put.description: Updates the notes for an item on a request with a given request-item association GUID, included in a request with a given GUID.

delete.summary: Remove an item from a request
delete.description: Removes an item with a given GUID from a request with a given GUID.

get.summary: Get details of a specific evaluation issue
get.description: Returns a specific Request Evaluation Issue object from a specific request.

put.summary: Update the content or visibility of an evaluation issue
put.description:
Returns a collection of Request Evaluation Issue objects for a specific request. For a full Request Evaluation Issue object, use the GET Request endpoint GET/requests//evaluationissues/.

This endpoint allows a user to edit an issue within the Evaluation view of a Request.
This endpoint is also functionally equivalent to correcting an evaluation issue. The only difference between an edit or a correction of an evaluation issue is that a correction occurs when a user modifies an evaluation issue after another user has responded to the original evaluation issue.

get.summary: Get details of a specific response to an evaluation issue
get.description: Returns a specific responses from a specific evaluation issue within a request.

put.summary: Update the content of a specific response
put.description: This endpoint allows a user to modify a response to an issue within the Evaluation view of a Request.

get.summary: Get details of a specific quality process
get.description: Returns a Quality Process object with a specific GUID.

put.summary: Update an existing quality process
put.description: Updates the metadata of a Quality Process object with a given GUID.

delete.summary: Delete a specific quality process
delete.description:
Deletes a Quality Process with a given GUID.

NOTES:
Any full user can delete a Quality Process via the API. This differs from the Arena application, in which users must be the owner of the process or an Account Administrator to delete a Quality Process.

get.summary: Get details of a specific step in a quality process
get.description: Returns a Quality Process Step object with a given GUID for a Quality Process with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update a specific step in a quality process

get.summary: Get details of a specific decision in a quality step

put.summary: Submit a decision for a sign-off step
put.description: Makes a decision on an existing Step object with a given GUID in a Quality Process with a given GUID. Decisions can only be made within a quality process sign-off step.

get.summary: Get details of a specific affected object in a quality step
get.description: Returns an Affected Object with a given GUID that appears in a step with a given GUID in a Quality Process with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update the note for an affected object in a quality step
put.description: Updates an existing Affected Object with a given GUID in a step with a given GUID in a Quality Process with a given GUID. Current supported Affected Objects are ITEMS, CHANGES, SUPPLIERS, SUPPLIER ITEMS, FILES, QUALITY, and URLs.

delete.summary: Remove an affected object from a quality step
delete.description: Deletes an Affected Object with a given GUID from Quality Process step with a given GUID in a Quality Process with a given GUID.

get.summary: Get details of a specific event in an integration
get.description: Returns an Event object matching the GUID.

put.summary: Update the reconciliation status of an integration event
put.description:
Updates the reconciliation status for all Items in an event with a given GUID.

Security: User must be an integration administrator.
If the event's itemsReconciled property is already set to the desired value, the response code will be 200 and no action will be performed.

get.summary: Get details of a specific item in an integration event
get.description: Returns an Item from an integration event with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update the reconciliation status of a specific event item
put.description:
Updates the reconciliation status for a specific event Item with a GUID in an event with a given GUID.

Security: User must be an integration administrator.
If the item's Reconciled property is already set to the desired value, the response code will be 200 and no action will be performed.
Changing the event item reconciled property may change the event's itemsReconciled property.

get.summary: Get details of a specific event in an outbound event integration
get.description: Returns a specific event for an outbound-event integration with a specific GUID.

put.summary: Update the reconciliation status of a specific event

get.summary: Get details of a specific resource in an outbound event integration event

put.summary: Update the reconciliation status of a specific resource
Logout Endpoint
put.description: This invalidates the access token. Once this is processed successfully, the user cannot use this token to perform any further actions.

get.summary: Retrieve detailed information of an item by its GUID, supporting different view formats
get.description: Returns an Item object with a given GUID. Note that while the standard practice is to retrieve an item GUID using the GET Items endpoint and then use an item GUID here (returning the effective revision), you can also use a GUID for a specific revision of an item here.

put.summary: Update the attributes of a specified item, supporting shared attributes and number reservation handling
put.description:
Updates the metadata of an item with a given GUID.

Editable attributes: Additional attribute values, category, description, name, offTheShelf, owner, shared, standardCost, targetCost, targetPrice, uom.

delete.summary: Delete the specified item
delete.description: Deletes an item with a given GUID.

get.summary: Retrieve detailed information of the specified sourcing relationship
get.description: Returns a Source Relationship object with a given GUID for an item with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update information of the specified sourcing relationship
put.description: Updates a Source Relationship object with a given GUID for an item with a given GUID. Note that updating a source relationship modifies the existing Source Relationship GUID on the working revision.

delete.summary: Delete the specified sourcing relationship
delete.description: Deletes a source relationship with a given GUID for an item with a given GUID.

get.summary: Retrieve detailed information of the specified reference item

put.summary: Update information of the specified reference item
put.description: Updates the metadata of an Item-To-Item reference with a given GUID

delete.summary: Delete the specified reference item
delete.description: Deletes an source Item reference with a given GUID for an item with a given GUID.

get.summary: Retrieve detailed information of the specified file association
get.description: Returns a File Association object with a given GUID belonging to an item with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update the metadata of the specified file association
put.description:
Updates the details of an existing File association with a given GUID.

This endpoint can only be used to update whether the latest edition of the File should be associated to the Item (latestEditionAssociation) or whether the associated File should be the primary File in the relationship (primary).

For updating File Summary information, use File endpoints such as PUT File Summary Update, POST File Edition, POST File Correct, etc.

delete.summary: Delete the specified file association
delete.description: Removes a File association from an Item with a given GUID.

get.summary: Retrieve details of compliance requirements for the specified item
get.description: Returns a Compliance Requirement object with a given GUID for an item with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update compliance requirements for the item
put.description: Updates a Compliance Requirement object with a given GUID for an item with a given GUID.

delete.summary: Delete compliance requirements for the item
delete.description:
Deletes a Compliance Requirement object with a given GUID for an item with a given GUID.

Propagated Compliance Requirements (where the propagated attribute is true) cannot be removed.
The Compliance Requirement is removed from the specified revision only and is not removed from any other revisions.

get.summary: Retrieve detailed information of the specified BOM line
get.description: Returns a BOM Line object with a given GUID, the immediate child of an assembly with a given GUID (with no filters.)

put.summary: Update information of the specified BOM line
put.description: Updates an existing BOM Line with a given GUID for an item with a given GUID.

delete.summary: Delete the specified BOM line
delete.description: Deletes a BOM Line with a given GUID from an Item with a given GUID.

get.summary: Retrieve detailed information of the specified substitute
get.description: Returns a BOM Substitute object with a given GUID, the immediate child of an assembly with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update information of the specified substitute
put.description:
Edits an existing BOM Substitute for an item with a given GUID.

Only the working revision of the parent Item can be modified with BOM Substitutes.
Items must be released to be specified as a substitute.
BOM Substitutes can be superseded revisions of the child Item.
Existing BOM Substitutes cannot be added again to the same BOM Line.

rank is a positive integer between one and the total number of substitutes.
If the user specifies a rank that already exists, the new BOM Substitute will be assigned that rank and the ranks of all other substitutes with a higher rank value (including the BOM Substitute that previously had the specified rank value) will be incremented by one.
If rank is not specified, it is set to the last rank.

delete.summary: Delete the specified substitute
delete.description: Deletes a BOM Substitute with a BOM Line.

get.summary: Retrieve BOM settings of the item
get.description:
Returns BOM Settings for the BOM of an Item with a given GUID.

The two settings available for BOMs are:
•automaticallyGenerateLineNumbers (true/false)
•checkReferenceDesignators (true/false)

put.summary: Update BOM settings of the item
put.description:
Updates BOM Settings for the BOM of an Item with a given GUID.

You can edit one or both of the following settings with the same request:
•automaticallyGenerateLineNumbers
•checkReferenceDesignators

get.summary: Get details of a specific import definition
get.description: Returns an Import Definition with a given GUID.

put.summary: Update an existing import definition
put.description: Edits the Import Definition name and description. Import Engine endpoints are only supported in Access Policies workspaces.

get.summary: Get details of a specific import run
get.description: Returns anImport Runs object with a given GUID.

put.summary: Re-run a previous import job using form data
Mark an import run as completed

get.summary: Retrieve detailed information of a file by its GUID
get.description: Returns a File object with a given GUID. This is the latest edition of the File.

put.summary: Update file metadata by its GUID
put.description:
Updates a File object.

Also supports updating storageMethodName from FILE, FTP, WEB, or PLACE_HOLDER to FTP, WEB, or PLACE_HOLDER. This update can only be performed on unlocked Files.

Updating storageMethodName to FTP, WEB, or PLACE_HOLDER also requires including the attribute location.

This endpoint does not support updating the storageMethodName from FTP, WEB, or PLACE_HOLDER to FILE. This requires a POST call. See POST File Update.

post.summary: Upload and update file content and metadata by its GUID
post.description:
Updates an existing File with storageMethodName FTP, WEB, or PLACE_HOLDER to FILE.

To update an existing File with a storageMethodName of FILE to FTP, WEB, or PLACE_HOLDER please refer to the PUT File Summary Update endpoint.

Construct a request with content-type multipart/form-data (in the header of the request) and file content.

Currently, only Files less than 2GB can be uploaded through this endpoint.

delete.summary: Delete the specified file
delete.description: Deletes the latest edition of a file with a given GUID. When a File has more than one edition, only the latest, unlocked edition can be deleted—to delete an entire file, repeat the DELETE request for all editions.

get.summary: Retrieve detailed file markup information of the specified file
get.description: Returns a File Markup object with a given GUID. This is the latest edition of the File.

put.summary: Update file markup metadata by its GUID
put.description:
Updates a File object.

Also supports updating storageMethodName from FILE, FTP, WEB, or PLACE_HOLDER to FTP, WEB, or PLACE_HOLDER. This update can only be performed on unlocked Files.

Updating storageMethodName to FTP, WEB, or PLACE_HOLDER also requires including the attribute location.

This endpoint does not support updating the storageMethodName from FTP, WEB, or PLACE_HOLDER to FILE. This requires a POST call. See POST File Update.

post.summary: Update file markup content by its GUID

delete.summary: Delete the specified markup file
delete.description: Deletes a File Markup with a given GUID. When a File has more than one Markup, only the latest, unlocked edition can be deleted--to delete an entire file, repeat the DELETE request for all editions.

get.summary: Get detailed information about a specific change
get.description: Returns a Change object with a given GUID. The attributes returned in the response differ according to the effectivityType. For example, a Change with a future effectivity (effectivityType=PERMANENT_ON_DATE) includes the attribute effectivityPlannedDateTime.

put.summary: Update the details of an existing change
put.description:
Updates attribute information for a change with a given GUID.

For an overview of the Change Lifecycle in Arena, including a summary of Lifecycle Rules, see About the Change Lifecycle.

Changes cannot be edited after they are submitted, with the following exceptions:
1. Approval Deadline and Expiration Date can be edited on Submitted and Effective Changes by Change Administrator users.
2. Implementation Status can be edited in any lifecycle phase.

delete.summary: Delete a specific change
delete.description: Deletes a change with a given GUID. Changes can only be deleted in the Open and Unlocked, Canceled, and Rejected lifecycle phases.

get.summary: Get details of a specific item in a change
get.description:
Returns a Change Affected Item with a given GUID included in a change with a given GUID. The response includes inventory disposition and information about each view of the item, including whether or not the view is included in the change and whether or not it contains modifications to the working revision.

Permanent Changes:
1. If the Item added to the Change is unreleased:
a. No affectedItemRevision attribute.
b. Before effective, newItemRevision GUID references the working revision.
c. After effective, newItemRevision GUID references the revision made effective by this Change.
d. newLifecyclePhase is the new phase introduced when the Change became effective.
e. newRevisionNumber is the new revision number made effective.
2. If the Item added to the Change is released:
a. Before effective:
i. newItemRevision GUID references the working revision (may change if released elsewhere).
ii. affectedItemRevision GUID references the effective revision.
b. After effective:
i. newItemRevision GUID references the revision made effective.
ii. affectedItemRevision GUID references the effective revision.
c. newLifecyclePhase is the new phase after Change is effective.
d. newRevisionNumber is the planned revision number, which becomes effective.

Temporary Changes:
a. Unreleased Items cannot be added. newLifecyclePhase and newRevisionNumber are not used.
b. Before effective, affectedItemRevision GUID is the effective revision.
c. After effective, affectedItemRevision GUID is the superseded revision; newItemRevision GUID is the new revision inserted.
d. After expiration, affectedItemRevision and newItemRevision GUIDs do not change.

put.summary: Update an item associated with a change
put.description:
Updates modification information for an item on a change with a given change-item association GUID, included in a change with a given GUID. This includes item views/notes, new revision number, new lifecycle phase, and inventory disposition information.

Item modifications can only be edited while a change is in the Open and Unlocked lifecycle phase. As soon as a change is submitted, all included Items are locked to modification.

When making edits to an Item's modification information, you must provide newRevisionNumber, even if you do not wish to change it from the current value.

delete.summary: Remove an item from a change
delete.description: Removes an item with a given GUID from a change with a given GUID. Items can only be removed from changes in the Open and Unlocked lifecycle phase.

put.summary: Update an existing implementation task
put.description: Edits an implementation task for a specific change. Note that Implementation Task Management and Object Level Override must be enabled for the category. If it is not enabled, the endpoints shall return an error indicating it is not enabled. Not supported for Canceled, Completed or Uncategorized changes. User must be a change administrator, creator of the change, or the current task assginee to perform this endpoint.

delete.summary: Delete an implementation task from a change
delete.description: Deletes a Change Implementation Task from a Change. Implementation Task Management and Object Level Override should be enabled. Change status cannot be canceled or completed. Endpoint can only be performed by the change administrator or the change creator.

put.summary: Update a note on an implementation task
put.description: Edits an implementation task note for an implementation task. Implementation Task Management must be enabled to execute this endpoint. Not supported for Canceled or Completed Changes.

delete.summary: Delete a note from an implementation task
delete.description: Deletes a specific note from a specific implementation task within a Change. Implementation Task Management needs to be enabled for this change category. Not supported for Canceled or Completed changes.

204.description: Delete Change Implementation Task Note Result

get.summary: Search for training plans using filters like number, name, or manager
get.description: Returns a collection of Training Plan objects matching the given search criteria.

post.summary: Create a new training plan
post.description: This endpoint creates a Training Plan. In order to create a Training Plan, the user must be a Training Plan Manager. For Access Policies workspaces, user must also contain a policy that includes an Edit Training Summary rule.

get.summary: List all users assigned to a training plan
get.description: Returns all the users (trainees) included within a Training Plan.

post.summary: Add a user to a training plan
post.description: This endpoint adds a user to a Training Plan. In order to add a user to a Training Plan, the user account executing the endpoint must be the Training Plan Manager.

get.summary: List all quality steps linked to a training plan
get.description: Returns all the Quality Processes and the specific step associated within a specific Training Plan. Using the browser-based application as a point of comparison, this endpoint returns the Quality Process (and the specified step) located within the References view of a specific Training Plan.

post.summary: Link a quality step to a training plan
post.description: This endpoint adds a Quality Process (with a specified step) as a reference to a Training Plan. Using the browser-based application as a point of comparison, this endpoint adds a specific Quality Process to the Reference view of a specific Training Plan.

get.summary: List all items associated with a training plan
get.description: Returns all the items associated within a specific Training Plan. In terms of the browser-based application, this endpoint returns the items located within the Items view of a specific Training Plan.

post.summary: Add an item to a training plan
post.description: This endpoint adds an Item to a Training Plan. In order to add a user to a Training Plan, the user account executing the endpoint must be the Training Plan Manager. Using the browser-based application as a point of comparison, this endpoint adds a specific item to the Items view of a specific Training Plan.

get.summary: List all files attached to a training plan
get.description: Returns all the files associated within a specific Training Plan. Using the browser-based application as a point of comparison, this endpoint returns the files located within the Files view of a specific Training Plan.

post.summary: Attach a new file to a training plan
post.description: Associates an existing file to the Files view of a Training Plan.

post.summary: Change the status of a training plan
post.description: The Training Plan Manager can change the status of their Training Plan through this endpoint. Supported statuses: CLOSED and OPEN.

get.summary: Search for tickets using filters like number, title, or status
get.description: Returns a collection of Ticket objects matching the given search criteria.

post.summary: Create a new ticket
post.description:
Users can assign a Ticket number via the following methods:
  1. Specify the numberSequencePrefix in the request body. User specifies the prefix while Arena auto-generates the next values to complete the Ticket number.
  2. Specify the number in the request body. User defines the entire Ticket number in the endpoint.
  3. User specifies neither of the above. The default numbering for the template will be used. If there are multiple sequences for the number, the first alphabetic prefix will be selected.

get.summary: List all tickets referenced by this ticket
get.description: Returns a collection of tickets added as references to a ticket object.

post.summary: Link another ticket to this ticket
post.description: Adds a ticket as a reference to a ticket.

get.summary: List all quality processes linked to a ticket
get.description: Returns a collection of quality processes added as references to a ticket object.

post.summary: Link a quality process to a ticket
post.description: Adds a quality process as a reference to a ticket.

get.summary: List all items linked to a ticket
get.description: Returns a collection of items added as references to a ticket object.

post.summary: Link an item to a ticket
post.description: Adds an item as a reference to a ticket.

get.summary: List all files attached to a ticket
get.description: Returns a collection of files associated with a Ticket object. These are files located within the Files view of a Ticket.

post.summary: Attach a file to a ticket
post.description: Associates an existing file to the Files view of a ticket.

get.summary: List all changes linked to a ticket
get.description: Returns a collection of changes added as references to a Ticket object.

post.summary: Link a change to a ticket
post.description: Adds a Change as a reference to a ticket.

post.summary: Change the status of a ticket
post.description: Users can change the status of a Ticket through this endpoint. Supported statuses: NOT_STARTED, IN_PROGRESS, and COMPLETE.

get.summary: Search for suppliers using filters like name
get.description: Returns a collection of Supplier objects matching the given search criteria.

post.summary: Create a new supplier
post.description:
NOTES:
1. The values you specify for attributes must match the attribute types specified in the workspace. For example, when specifying a value for a predefined list, the value must be one of the allowed values.
2. Number values must appear in quotation marks.

get.summary: List all phone numbers associated with a supplier
get.description: Returns the phone numbers of a Supplier object with a given GUID.

post.description: Creates a new phone number for a Supplier object.

get.summary: List all files attached to a supplier
get.description: Returns a collection of File objects belonging to a Supplier with a given GUID.

get.summary: List all addresses associated with a supplier
get.description: Returns the addresses a Supplier object with a given GUID.

post.summary: Add a new address to a supplier
post.description: Creates new addresses for a Supplier object.

get.summary: Search for supplier items using filters like number or name

post.summary: Create a new supplier item

post.summary: Upload a new thumbnail image for a supplier item
post.description: This endpoint uploads an image to the Supplier Item's Specs view thumbnail.

delete.summary: Delete the thumbnail image of a supplier item
delete.description: Deletes the Supplier Item Image Thumbnail Image of an Supplier Item with a specific GUID. The Supplier Item Thumbnail Image is located in the Specs view of a Supplier Item.

get.summary: List all files associated with a supplier item
get.description: Returns an array of File objects belonging to a supplier item with a given GUID.

post.summary: Upload a new file and associate it with a supplier item

get.summary: List compliance requirements for a supplier item
get.description: Returns all Compliance Requirement objects for a supplier item with a given GUID.

post.summary: Add a new compliance requirement to a supplier item
post.description:
Creates a Compliance Requirement object with a given GUID for a Supplier Item with a given GUID.

NOTES:
Only one of each requirement can be added to a Supplier Item.

accountUser.guid or accountUser.email is required. If both are included, they must match the same account.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all machine users
get.description: The GET Machine Users endpoint returns all Machine Users in the account that the API user is logged into.

post.summary: Add a new machine user
post.description:
The POST Employee Users endpoint creates a Machine User for the account associated with the Arena session's workspace. It excludes integration & machine users.

This endpoint does not support setting the password or token for Machine Users. POST sets the password automatically to a secure random string and does not set the token. Passwords can be set by the user manually in the UI.
This endpoint does not support the ForIntegrationUse attribute.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all employees in the account
get.description:
Users are managed in Arena at the account level. Users can then belong to 0 or more workspaces that are associated with the account.

The GET Employee Users endpoint returns an array of Employee Users for the account associated with the Arena session's workspace. It excludes integration & machine users.

post.summary: Add a new employee to the account
post.description:
Users are managed in Arena at the account level. Users can then belong to 0 or more workspaces that are associated with the account.

The POST Employee Users endpoint creates an Employee User for the account associated with the Arena session's workspace. It excludes integration & machine users.

Neither Two Factor Authentication (twoFactorAuthenticationConfigured) nor Security Questions (securityQuestionConfigured) can be set using this endpoint.
This endpoint does not support the ForIntegrationUse attribute.
There is no response for temporaryPassword and notifyUser.

post.summary: execute the search
post.description: Returns a collection of arena objects.

get.summary: Search for requests using filters like number, title, or status
get.description: Returns a collection of Requests objects matching the given search criteria. Note that the Requests returned here are a compact version. For a full Request object, use the GET Request endpoint GET/requests/guid.

post.summary: Create a new request
post.description: In all cases, numberSequencePrefix is required. If a default numberSequencePrefix is associated with the specified request category, not specifying a numberSequencePrefix will result in automatically selecting the default.

get.summary: List all markup files attached to a request
get.description: Returns a collection of Markup Files associated with a specific Request.

post.summary: Create a markup file for a specific request

get.description: Returns all Request Items included in a request with a given GUID.

post.summary: Add a new item to a request

get.summary: List all files attached to a request
get.description: Returns a list of files for a Request with a given GUID.

post.description: Associates an existing File Association object with the Files view of a Request with a given GUID.

get.summary: List all evaluation issues for a request
get.description: Returns a collection of Request Evaluation Issue objects for a specific request. For a full Request Evaluation Issue object, use the GET Request endpoint GET/requests/<GUID>/evaluationissues/<GUID>

post.summary: Create a new evaluation issue for a request
post.description: This endpoint allows a user to create or 'raise' an issue within the Evaluation view of a Request.

get.summary: List all responses to a specific evaluation issue

post.summary: Change the status of an evaluation issue

get.summary: Search for quality processes using filters like number, name, or owner
get.description: Returns a collection of Quality Process objects matching the given search criteria.

post.summary: Create a new quality process
post.description:
Creates a new Quality Process.

NOTES:
1. If no default owner is specified for the template, you must include the GUID of an eligible owner. Otherwise, the Create Quality Process endpoint will return an error. Find eligible owners using the Get Quality Process Owners endpoint.
2. To create a new number for the Quality Process, the API requires that you pass the GUID for the number format prefix only. The rest of the number is autogenerated.

get.summary: List all decisions made in a quality step
get.description: Returns the decisions of users in a Quality Process sign-off step when given the GUID of the Quality Process and the GUID of the Quality sign-off step.

post.summary: Add an approver to a sign-off step
post.description: Adds decision makers on an existing Step object with a given GUID in a Quality Process with a given GUID.

get.summary: List all affected objects in a quality step
get.description: Returns a collection of Affected Objects for a step with a given GUID in a Quality Process with a given GUID.

post.summary: Add an affected object to a quality step
post.description: Adds an Affected Object in a step with a given GUID in a Quality Process with a given GUID. The type can be ITEM, REQUEST, CHANGE, SUPPLIER, SUPPLIER ITEM, FILE, QUALITY, or URL.

post.summary: Change the status of a quality process or one of its steps
post.description:
Completes a specific Quality Process step.

NOTES:
1. Assigned Quality Process steps (excluding sign-off steps) can be completed by the Quality Process Step Assignee or the Quality Process Owner.
2. Quality Process steps without an assignee (excluding sign-off steps) can be completed by any user with permissions.
3. Quality Process steps (excluding sign-off steps) cannot be completed if the Quality Process itself is completed.
4. Quality Process sign-off steps cannot be completed by this endpoint.
5. For Access Policies: A user must have the Quality Edit Details rule enabled to complete a Quality Process step.
Reopens a Quality Process step.

NOTES:
1. Assigned Quality Process steps (excluding sign-off steps) can be reopened by the Quality Process Step Assignee or the Quality Process Owner.
2. Quality Process steps without an assignee (excluding sign-off steps) can be reopened by any user with permissions.
3. Quality Process steps (excluding sign-off steps) cannot be reopened if the Quality Process itself is completed.
4. Quality Process approved sign-off steps cannot be reopened or reversed by this endpoint.
5. For Access Policies: A user must have the Quality Edit Details rule enabled to reopen a Quality Process step.

post.summary: Login Endpoint
post.description:
This logs a valid user into the Arena System and, once authentication is successful, a JSON response with an access token is returned. The token must be set in the headers of all subsequent requests for them to be processed successfully. The API client should add an HTTP header with the name arena_session_id, the same cookie name as in the Arena Web Application.

Note: If you do not specify a workspace_id value in the call, the API user will log in to its current workspace, or whichever it was last logged into.

The response to each Log In request includes the value workspaceRequestLimit, which is the maximum number of API requests allowed for your workspace during a 24-hour period. For all responses in the session, the remaining number of API requests for the current period and the scheduled time for resetting of the count are included in the HTTP headers.

get.summary: Search and return a list of items matching the criteria, supporting various query parameters and view formats
get.description: Returns a collection of Compact Item objects matching the given search criteria.

post.summary: Create a new item, supporting feature application data and number reservation handling
post.description:
Creates a new Item object.

You can specify no number format, the basic number format, or a valid number format for the workspace (with or without an auto-generating sequence). In these cases, you must specify valid values for each field type in the number format. Each case is shown below.

NOTES:
1. The values you specify for attributes must match the attribute types specified in the workspace. For example, when specifying a value for a predefined list, the value must be one of the allowed values.
2. Category and other IDs must exist in the workspace.
3. A category GUID is required.

get.summary: Retrieve all sourcing relationship information of the item
get.description: Returns an array of Source Relationship objects for an item with a given GUID.

post.summary: Create new sourcing relationship for the item
post.description:
Creates a new Source Relationship for an item with a given GUID.

You can create two types of source relationship:
• Direct relationship: You get a manufacturer Item directly from the manufacturer. The manufacturer and vendor items are the same. You can also specify a Make-Item relationship (where your own company makes the part) by setting MakeItem to True.
• Indirect relationship: You buy a manufacturer item from a vendor. The manufacturer and vendor items are different. You can also create an 'any' relationship by omitting the manufacturer or vendor item.

Notes:
1. The suppliers and supplier items named in the source relationship must already exist in the workspace. Find their GUIDs with Get Supplier and Get Supplier Item requests.
2. Attribute values must match the types specified in the workspace. For predefined lists, use allowed values.
3. Number values must appear in quotation marks.

get.summary: Retrieve reference item collection of the item

post.summary: Create reference item for the item
post.description:
Creates a new Item-to-Item reference for an item with a given GUID.

Notes:
1. Item references are bidirectional. Creating an Item reference between Items means both Items will appear in each other's Items view.
2. References are not revision controlled or revision specific, and can only be created between released Items.

post.summary: Upload image and set it as the thumbnail of the item
post.description: This endpoint uploads an image to the Item's Specs view.

delete.summary: Delete the thumbnail of the item
delete.description: Deletes the Item Image Thumbnail Image of an Item with a specific GUID. The Item Thumbnail Image is located in the Specs view of an Item.

get.summary: Retrieve all file association information of the specified item
get.description: Returns a collection of File objects belonging to an item with a given GUID. To return a specific File association for an Item, append the GUID of the association.

post.summary: Create file association for an item (including file content)
post.description:
Creates a new File Association object and associates it with an item with a given GUID.

If you wish to create a File record with no uploaded content, construct a JSON request with a storageMethodName of PLACE_HOLDER, FTP, or WEB.
When the storageMethodName is FTP or WEB, the location attribute should be the web or ftp address where the file resides.

If you wish to create a File record and upload file content to the Arena servers, construct a request that is content type multipart/form-data and has a storageMethodName of FILE.
For File editions with storageMethodName FILE, the location attribute should be null.

NOTES:
1. Only Item files are supported for this endpoint. Files associated with sourced Supplier Items use /supplieritems/<GUID>/files.

get.summary: Download the file content of the specified file association
get.description: Returns file content belonging to a file with a given GUID, which is associated with an item with a given GUID.

post.summary: Upload or update the file content of the specified file association
post.description: Updates file content for an existing File with a given GUID associated with an item with a given GUID.

get.summary: Retrieve all compliance requirements for the specified item
get.description: Returns all Compliance Requirement objects for an item with a given GUID.

post.summary: Create new compliance requirements for the item
post.description:
Creates a Compliance Requirement object with a given GUID for an item with a given GUID.

Only one of each Compliance Requirement can be added to an Item.
Any Item revision can have compliance added.
If the Compliance Requirement is added to the effective revision, it is also added to the working revisions of the Item.

get.summary: Retrieve the BOM (Bill of Materials) collection of the item
get.description: Returns an array of BOM Line objects, the immediate children of an assembly with a given GUID (with no filters.)

post.summary: Add new BOM line for the item
post.description: Creates a new BOM Line for an item with a given GUID. A BOMLine consists of an item and the reference designator, quantity, and notes that appear on its line in a BOM.

get.summary: Retrieve the substitute collection of the specified BOM line
get.description: Returns a BOM Substitute object with a given GUID, the immediate child of an assembly with a given GUID.

post.summary: Add substitutes for the BOM line
post.description:
Creates a new BOM Substitute for an item with a given GUID.

Only the working revision of the parent Item can be modified with BOM Substitutes.
Items must be released to be specified as a substitute.
BOM Substitutes can be superseded revisions of the child Item.
Existing BOM Substitutes cannot be added again to the same BOM Line.

rank is a positive integer between one and the total number of substitutes.
If the user specifies a rank that already exists, the new BOM Substitute will be assigned that rank and the ranks of all other substitutes with a higher rank value (including the BOM Substitute that previously had the specified rank value) will be incremented by one.
If rank is not specified in the POST, it is set to the last rank.

post.summary: Update lifecycle phase of the item
post.description:
Releases a new revision of an item with a given GUID to a target lifecycle phase specified within the request.

Returns revision GUIDs for effective, superseded, and working revisions of the item.

The following phase transitions are allowed:
1. Release to Design (move an unreleased Item to a Design stage lifecycle phase.)
2. Make Effective in Design (make working modifications effective in a new revision while remaining in the same Design phase.)
3. Release to Production (move a Design stage Item to a Production stage lifecycle phase.)
4. Make Effective in Production (make working modifications effective in a new revision while remaining in the same Production phase.)

Release to Design, Make Effective in Design, and Make Effective in Production require the working revision of the item. Release to Production requires the item GUID to be the effective revision.
The target lifecycle phase can be any defined for the workspace, including custom phases.

This API request can generate errors, warnings, and notices. The request will fail if there is at least one error or warning. If proceedOnNotice is True, the request will continue if it generates notices.

get.summary: Search for import definitions using filters like name or creator
get.description: Returns a collection of Import Definition objects matching the given search criteria.

post.summary: Create a new import definition
post.description: Creates a new Import Definition object. Note that all Import Engine endpoints are only supported in Access Policies workspaces.

get.summary: Search for import run jobs using filters like status or creator
get.description: Returns Import Runs objects that are the result of an import definition.

post.summary: Start a new import run with file uploads
post.description:
Initiates an Import run using an import source file in conjunction with an existing Import Definition. Creates an Import Run object.

Notes:
1. The import run endpoint executes an import definition.
2. Import results are saved in Arena and expire after 60 days. Once expired, the results files are deleted in Arena and are no longer available.
3. Import Limits: COMING SOON.

Import runs can have the following six statuses.

get.summary: Search for files using filters like number or title
get.description: Returns a collection of Compact Files matching the given search criteria. The editions returned are the latest editions for each matching file.

post.summary: Creates a new File object
post.description:
Creates a new File object.

If you wish to create a File record and upload file content to the Arena servers, construct a request that is content type multipart/form-data (specified in the header) and has a storageMethodName of FILE (stored on Arena servers).

If you wish to create a File record with no uploaded content, construct a JSON request with a storageMethodName of FTP (stored on user FTP server), WEB (web link), or PLACE_HOLDER (will upload content later).

When the storageMethod is FTP or WEB, the location attribute should be the web or ftp address where the file resides. For Files with storageMethodName FILE, the location attribute is not used.

Currently, only Files less than 2GB can be uploaded through this endpoint.

get.summary: Retrieve all file markup information of the specified file
get.description: Returns a collection of Markup Files associated with a specific File.

post.summary: Create file markup for specific file edition (including file content)
post.description:
Creates a File Markup File object.

If you wish to create a File record and upload file content to the Arena servers, construct a request that is content type multipart/form-data (specified in the header) and has a storageMethodName of FILE (stored on Arena servers).

If you wish to create a File record with no uploaded content, construct a JSON request with a storageMethodName of FTP (stored on user FTP server), WEB (web link), or PLACE_HOLDER (will upload content later).

When the storageMethod is FTP or WEB, the location attribute should be the web or ftp address where the file resides. For Files with storageMethodName FILE, the location attribute is not used.

Currently, only Files less than 2GB can be uploaded through this endpoint.

get.summary: Retrieve all edition information of the file
get.description: Returns a collection of File objects for a File with a given GUID.

post.summary: Upload file to create next edition by file GUID
post.description:
Creates a new edition for a File with a given GUID.

If you wish to create an edition with no uploaded content, construct a JSON request with a storageMethodName of FTP (stored on user FTP server) or WEB (web link). When the storageMethodName is FTP or WEB, the location attribute should be the web or ftp address where the file resides.

If you wish to create an edition and upload file content to the Arena servers, construct a request that is content type multipart/form-data (specified in the header) and has a storageMethodName of FILE (stored on Arena servers).

For File editions with storageMethodName FILE, the location attribute is not used.

When a file is checked out this call will return a 400 (Bad Request) error.

When posting multipart with file content, Arena does not return any JSON response so you must rely on the status of 400. The calling program should check for File checkout ("locked" : true) and respond accordingly.

Currently, only Files less than 2GB can be uploaded through this endpoint.

get.summary: Retrieve all file correction information of the file
get.description: Returns a collection of corrected File objects for a File with a given GUID.

post.summary: Create file correction for specific file edition (including file content)
post.description: Modify or correct the content of an existing file edition that is otherwise locked or immutable.

get.summary: Download file content by its GUID
get.description: Returns file content belonging to a file with a given GUID.

post.summary: Upload and update file content by its GUID
post.description:
Updates the content of a File edition, replacing the previous content.

Construct a request with content-type multipart/form-data (in the header of the request) and file content.

Currently, only Files less than 2GB can be uploaded through this endpoint.

post.summary: Check in file for specific file edition (including file content)
post.description:
Only the user who checked out the File or an Account administrator can cancel the checkout.

The existing edition of the File cannot be checked in if the edition is locked (for example, it is associated with an effective item).

A new edition of the File can be checked in even if the existing edition is locked. Only Files of storageMethod FILE can be checked in.

User must have a Full license to perform the File checkin. User must also have access to edit the File and full access to the File category.

get.summary: List all runs for a specific extract
get.description:
Returns Extract Run objects for an extract with a given GUID. Appending a run GUID returns the run with that GUID.

When a Data Extract file is generated, only users listed in the Owners field can access the Extract ZIP file. API users must also be listed as owners to access the file, even if they initiated the extract.

post.summary: Start a new extract run
post.description:
Allows a user or a machine to run a DataExtract through Arenas API. Creates an Extract Run object for a run with a given GUID for an extract with a given GUID.

When a Data Extract file is generated, only users listed in the Owners field can access the Extract ZIP file. API users must also be listed as owners to access the file, even if they initiated the extract.

get.summary: Search for export definitions using filters like name or creator
get.description: Returns a collection of Export Definition objects matching the given search criteria.

post.summary: Create a new export definition
post.description:
Creates a new Export Definition object.

Notes:
1. Export Definitions cannot be edited or deleted.
2. Criteria can be specified in the Export Definition or in the Export Run.
3. Criteria cannot be specified in both the Export Definition and in the Export Run. It also cannot be specified in neither.
4. Export results are saved in Arena and expire after 60 days. Once expired, the results files are deleted in Arena and are no longer available.
5. Export Limits: If the criteria return more than 20,000 items, then an error shall be returned. If the criteria return more than 5,000 items, and BOM and FILES view are included as exportViews, then an error shall be returned.
6. For an Item Export with revisionStatus set to LATEST used with modifiedBOM, the modifiedBOM attribute refers to the working revision for released Items. Released, effective revisions can't have a modified BOM. This applies to modifiedSpecs, modifiedSourcing, and modifiedFiles with revisionStatus LATEST.
7. Arena Export does not support export for category.guid using the GUID for uncategorized. For uncategorized Items, use criteria: attribute is category.name, operator is IS_EQUAL_TO, value is -uncategorized-.
8. Item Export with revisionStatus WORKING or POTENTIAL returns the working revision even if an effective, released version exists.
9. See Export Options for a full list of options.
10. If export format is JSON and certain Export Options are selected, the JSON export file may be empty.

get.summary: Search for export run jobs using filters like status or number
get.description: Returns the runs executed by an export definition with a given GUID.

post.summary: Start a new export run based on an export definition
post.description:
Initiates an Export run based on an existing Export Definition.

Notes:
1. The export run endpoint executes an export definition.
2. If criteria was specified in the export definition, that criteria will be used in the run and cannot be specified in the export run.
3. If criteria was not specified in the export definition, a criteria must be specified in the export run.
4. Export results are saved in Arena and expire after 60 days. Once expired, the results files are deleted in Arena and are no longer available.
5. Export Limits: If the criteria return more than 20,000 items, then an error shall be returned. If the criteria return more than 5,000 items, and BOM and FILES view are included as exportViews, then an error shall be returned.

get.summary: Search for changes using filters like number, title, or status
get.description:
Returns a collection of Change objects matching the given search criteria. The Changes returned here are a compact version. For a full Change object, use the GET Change endpoint GET/changes/{guid}.

Changes include different attributes depending on the effectivityType (PERMANENT_ON_APPROVAL, PERMANENT_ON_DATE, or TEMPORARY) and lifecyclePhase (OPEN_AND_UNLOCKED, OPEN_AND_LOCKED, SUBMITTED_FOR_ROUTING, SUBMITTED_FOR_APPROVAL, REJECTED, CANCELED, APPROVED, EFFECTIVE, COMPLETED, or EXPIRED).

post.summary: Create a new change
post.description:
Creates a new Change object. You can create changes with three different types of effectivity:

1. Permanent on Approval: The Change becomes effective immediately upon the last necessary vote being entered.
2. Permanent on Date: The Change enters the Approved state upon the last necessary vote being entered, but does not become effective until the specified date. Requires the attribute plannedEffectivityDateTime.
3. Temporary: Changes with temporary effectivity (often called Deviations) become effective immediately upon the last necessary vote being entered, and expire on a specified date. Requires the attribute expirationDate.

In all cases, numberSequencePrefix is required. If a default numberSequencePrefix is associated with the specified change category, not specifying a numberSequencePrefix will result in automatically selecting the default.

Below are examples of each type of Change, including all fields that can be created for each effectivity type.

get.summary: List all requests associated with a change
get.description: Returns all the requests associated with a specific change. Users must have a Read Change Summary and Edit Change Requests rule for the Change. Additionally users must have a Read Request Summary rule for the request being added.

post.summary: Link a request to a change
post.description:
Adds a Request to a Change. Users must have a Read Change Summary and Edit Change Requests rule for the Change. Additionally users must have a Read Request Summary rule for the request being added.
The Change must have a lifecycle status of OPEN_AND_UNLOCKED. The Request being added must have a lifecycle status of PROMOTED.

get.summary: List all markup files for a change
get.description: Returns a collection of Markup Files associated with a specific Change.

post.summary: Attach a new markup file to a change
post.description: Creates a Change File Markup File object.

get.summary: List all items associated with a change
get.description: Returns all Change Affected Items included in a change with a given GUID. The response includes inventory dispostion and information about each view of each item, including whether it is included in the change and whether it contains modifications to the working revision.

post.summary: Add a new item to a change
post.description:
Adds an item to a change with a specific GUID.

For an overview of the Change Lifecycle in Arena, including a summary of Lifecycle Rules for adding Items to Changes, see About the Change Lifecycle.

NOTES:
1. newItemRevision is the GUID of the working revision of the Item being added. In workspaces with Revision Sequences, newRevisionNumber can be omitted if a next revision is available.
2. affectedItemRevision is the GUID of the effective revision of the Item being added.
3. The GUID in the response is the Change-Item association GUID, used in the PUT Change Affected Item endpoint.
4. If includedInThisChange=false for any view, the notes field is not allowed.
5. When adding items to a Change with temporary effectivity, no views can be specified.

get.summary: List all implementation tasks for a change
get.description: Returns the implementation tasks for a specific change category. Note that Implementation Task Management must be enabled for the category. If it is not enabled, the endpoints shall return an error indicating it is not enabled.

post.summary: Create a new implementation task for a change
post.description: Creates an implementation tasks for a specific change. Note that Implementation Task Management and Object Level Override must be enabled for the category. If it is not enabled, the endpoints shall return an error indicating it is not enabled. Not supported for Canceled, Completed or Uncategorized changes.

get.summary: List all notes for a specific implementation task
get.description: Returns the notes in a specific implementation task within a specific change. Only supported in categories that have Implementation Task Management enabled.

post.summary: Add a new note to an implementation task
post.description: Adds a note to a change implementation task. Implementation Task Management must be enabled to execute this endpoint. Not supported for Canceled or Completed Changes.

get.summary: List all files attached to an implementation task
get.description: Retrieves the files associated with a change implementation task. Implementation Task Management must be enabled within the specific change category.

post.summary: Attach a new file to an implementation task
post.description: Adds a specific, already existing in the workspace, File to a specific implementation task. Implementation Task Management must be enabled to execute this endpoint. Not supported for Canceled or Completed Changes.

get.summary: List all implementation files for a change
get.description: Returns a list of file objects associated with the Implementation view of a Change with a specific GUID.

post.summary: Attach a new implementation file to a change
post.description: Associates an existing File Association object with the Implementation Files view of a Change with a given GUID.

get.description: Returns a list of Files for a Change with a given GUID.
